johnson & johnson is working to address climate change through various initiatives, including:

1. reducing greenhouse gas emissions: johnson & johnson has set a target to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. to achieve this goal, the company is implementing numerous energy efficiency measures, investing in renewable energy sources, and promoting the use of electric vehicles.

2. sustainable packaging: the company is working to reduce its use of plastic packaging and transitioning to more sustainable materials like paper and eco-friendly plastics. johnson & johnson is also investing in innovative new packaging technologies that are both more sustainable and help prolong the product shelf life.

3. sustainable sourcing: johnson & johnson has set a goal to source 100% renewable electricity for all its facilities by 2050. the company also aims to source all of its palm oil from sustainable sources by the end of 2020.

4. partnerships and collaborations: johnson & johnson is collaborating with other companies and organizations to accelerate progress toward a more sustainable future. for instance, the company is a member of the united nations global compact, which brings together businesses to work toward sustainable development goals.

overall, johnson & johnson is taking a comprehensive approach to addressing climate change and working to reduce its environmental impact across its entire value chain.
